business.headline: Government mulls Universal Pension Scheme: Who will it benefit? Check details The ministry of labour and employment is working on the proposed plan, which is expected to bring existing pension schemes under one framework.

Explained: Why European Union wants India to cut tariffs on cars, wineApart from trade, the EU also sees India as an important security partner, given rising cyber threats and tensions in regions like the South China Sea and the Indo-Pacific.
Azad Engineering launches Rs 700 crore QIP: All you need to knowThe company's board approved the opening of the issue on February 25 for the QIP of equity shares with a face value of Rs 2 each.

Volkswagen only carmaker to wrongly classify car imports: Tax authoritiesIndia says Volkswagen used a clandestine scheme to import auto parts in separate shipments, to evade detection and cut taxes, instead of declaring items as "completely knocked down", or CKD, units that face higher taxes of 30% to 35%.
Gold, stocks, or property: Which investment can make you richer?More people are turning to stocks, gold, and real estate to grow their wealth, but choosing the right one can be tricky.

Capgemini CEO on ideal workweek: Not 90, not 70, not even 50 hoursCapgemini India's CEO, Ashwin Yardi, has introduced a different perspective, one that supports a more balanced approach in the debate about work-life balance and working hours in a week.

Defence stocks like BEL, HAL are in a slump. Is it an opportunity to buy? Even after the drop, analysts remain bullish about defence stocks. In the case of BEL, 24 out of 27 analysts have a 'buy' rating on the stock. Most analysts also remain positive about HAL's stock.

Tesla shares tumble nearly 9%, market value dips below $1 trillion. Here's whyTesla share price: The decline followed data from the European Automobile Manufacturers Association, which reported Tesla's sales in Europe fell 45% in January.

Tata Motors shares down 44% from 52-week high. Should you buy the dip?Tata Motors shares: In the previous trading session, the stock closed lower 1.2% lower at Rs 660.30. So far this year, it's lost over 11%. In six months, it's down 40%. Over a year, it's fallen 30%.

RBI eases lending rules for small borrowers and NBFCs. Here's what it meansThe RBI has also put on hold its earlier proposals to increase the capital that banks must set aside for new project loans and the liquidity they need to maintain for digital deposits.

New India Co-op Bank vault had 12 times its capacity on paper: Report The Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) is probing an alleged Rs 122-crore embezzlement at the bank and has arrested three people so far, including two former senior executives of the lender.

Infosys employees get 5-8% salary hikes, lower than before: ReportThe IT firm sent salary revision letters to employees, offering hikes between 5% and 8% for most, depending on their performance rating.

entertainment.headline: Rapper Kanye West trying to save marriage with Bianca Censori: ReportKanye West is reportedly trying to prevent his marriage with Bianca Censori from ending. An insider reveals that Bianca is considering divorce, and Kanye is panicking.

Singer Palash Sen on working with Akshay Kumar, not being 'accepted' by BollywoodEuphoria's lead vocalist Palash Sen spoke to India Today Digital about collaborating with Bollywood star Akshay Kumar on the song Mahakal Chalo, work opportunities in the Hindi film industry, and more in an exclusive interaction.

Actors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalwani to separate after 9 years of marriageActors Aman Verma and Vandana Lalvani are separating after nine-years of marriage. Amid growing speculation, Aman has addressed the rumours about their relationship facing trouble.

Baalveer actor Dev Joshi marries girlfriend Aarti, first pics outBaalveer actor Dev Joshi married his girlfriend Aarti in a beautiful ceremony. The wedding festivities, including haldi and mehndi, were spectacular and captured in stunning photos.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan, Inayat Verma series to stream in MarchThe streaming date of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma-starrer Be Happy is out. It promises to be a touching film about a single father's journey to support his daughter's dream of performing on a dance reality show.

A Man on the Inside: Ted Danson's charming comedy deserves more loveA Man on the Inside is a warm and witty series which tackles multiple subjects, including loss, new beginnings and, well, crime. The Ted Danson-starrer is currently streaming on Netflix.

Shreya Ghoshal on Chikni Chameli: Embarrassed when 5-year-old girls sing itShreya Ghoshal says she feels embarrassed when young girls sing Chikni Chameli, stressing that lyrics should be written more thoughtfully, as music and films have a deep impact on society.

Hina Khan updates fans about cancer treatment: My chemo and surgery are overHina Khan recently gave an update about her cancer treatment. The actor mentioned that her chemotherapy and surgery are over.

Tanmay Bhat jokes about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his textsTanmay Bhat hilariously addressed the India's Got Latent controversy, joking about Ranveer Allahbadia ignoring his texts. The reaction video left fellow comedians laughing and also "triggered" them.

Singer Udit Narayan visits Maha Kumbh Mela with wife, expresses gratitude Singer Udit Narayan was among the latest celebrities to visit the holy city of Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh 2025. In an interview with ANI, he expressed his gratitude and congratulated Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for the well-organised and efficient arrangements.

My Dearest Nemesis review: Chaotic chemistry makes even familiar trope workMy Dearest Nemesis features K-drama stars Moon Ga young and Choi Hyun-wook in the lead. It is available to stream on Viki. Here's our take on the romantic drama.

Internet calls Farah Khan 'insensitive' for mocking Gaurav Khanna's colour blindnessCelebrity MasterChef judge Farah Khan mocked TV actor Gaurav Khanna's colour blindness on the show. Following the same, the internet is outraged by her comments, criticising the filmmaker and calling her 'insensitive'.

Parineeti Chopra gears up for her first Netflix yet-to-be-titled thriller seriesActor Parineeti Chopra is set to make her series OTT debut with a Netflix project. The actor shared a post and informed about sharing screen space with Nimrit Kaur, Soni Razdan, and others.

Tanmay Bhat's X account hacked, comedian warns followersTanmay Bhat's X account recently got hacked, leading to fraudulent messages being posted online. The comedian shared a post on his Instagram and warned his followers.

Prajakta Koli-Vrishank Khanal can't take their eyes off each other in haldi picsActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry longtime boyfriend Vrishank Khanan on February 25. Ahead of the grand day, the actor shared pictures from her haldi function.

Anupam Mittal on India's Got Latent backlash: Not a lost episode of Satyamev JayateAnupam Mittal weighs in on the India's Got Latent row, arguing that YouTube should also be held accountable. He calls Big Tech the real culprit, criticising digital platforms for fueling outrage-driven content.

Bobby Deol says Aashram helped him break industry image, explore new rolesActor Bobby Deol is all set to return as Baba Nirala in Prakash Jha's series, Aashram 3 part 2. The actor confessed that he wanted to step out of his comfort zone.

Waking of Nation trailer: Taaruk Raina fights to prove Jallianwala Bagh was plannedA new show that explores the events surrounding the Jallianwala Bagh massacre is set to premiere on Sony LIV on March 8. Starring Taaruk Raina in the lead role, the series is titled The Waking of a Nation.
Singer Justin Bieber responds to rumours of drug useJustin Bieber's representative has reacted to the reports of the singer's drug use and called them false.

Ranveer Allahbadia runs to car after recording statement in Latent probeRanveer Allahbadia was clicked in a hurried state, running towards his car as the paparazzi tried to capture his pictures on Monday. The YouTuber visited the Maharashtra Cyber office in Mahape after recording his statement.

Kaushaljis vs Kaushal review: A simple yet complex tale of second chance in loveReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Kaushaljis vs Kaushal movie review: This film is a heartfelt exploration of second chances in love, focusing on a middle-aged couple navigating the complexities of separation and familial expectations. Set in the relatable backdrop of Kannauj, the film captivates with its simplicity and stellar performances.

Dupahiya trailer: A wedding, a missing bike and a lot of chaos in offingThe first full trailer of Prime Video's upcoming comedy series, Dupahiya, is here. The show will feature actors such as Sparsh Shrivastava and Gajraj Rao in pivotal roles.

Bride-to-Be Prajakta Koli dances to Zingaat with fiance at mehndi ceremony. WatchPrajakta Koli shared glimpses of her mehndi ceremony as she danced joyfully with fiance Vrishank Khanal. The couple is set to marry on February 25.

Zero Day review: Star power can't save this weakly executed political dramaReleased-Thu Feb 20, 2025Zero Day, directed by Lesli Linka Glatter, is a political drama featuring a stellar cast including Robert De Niro and Angela Bassett. While the performances are strong, the series struggles with plot depth and resolution.

Watch: Jennie and Doechii bring the heat with ExtraL ahead of RubyJennie and Doechii are making waves with their latest collaboration, ExtraL. As Jennie gears up for her solo debut with the album Ruby, fans can expect a bold new chapter in her musical journey.

Complaint against Munawar Faruqui for 'insulting religion' on Hafta Vasooli showComedian Munawar Faruqui landed in legal trouble after a complaint was filed against him for hurting religious sentiments through his show, Hafta Vasooli. The advocate shared a copy of the complaint on X.

'Mismatched' actor Prajakta Koli shares dreamy pics from her mehndiContent creator and actor Prajakta Koli has started her pre-wedding celebrations with a vibrant mehndi ceremony. She shared joyful moments with her fiance Vrishank Khanal and family on social media.

Honey Singh's Millionaire concert in Mumbai showed what grand comebacks look likeYo Yo Honey Singh made a powerful return to the stage in Mumbai, captivating fans with his energy and heartfelt messages. His performance was a testament to his resilience and dedication to the art.

Samay Raina recalls what he asked Tanmay Bhat after India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina addresses the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remark on his show, India's Got Latent, during his tour in Canada. He recalled what he had asked Tanmay Bhat after the controversy erupted.
Honey Singh's jibe at Raftaar, Badshah: People say they'll write my destinyHoney Singh took a direct dig at fellow artists Badshah and Raftaar at the first Millionaire India Tour stop in Mumbai.

Watch: Honey Singh's take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi Aa Gaya Oye'Honey Singh launched his Millionaire India Tour in Mumbai, delivering a captivating performance that engaged a sold-out audience. He shared his take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi aa gays oye', emphasising unity among diverse Indian communities.

Watch: Honey Singh kicks off Millionaire tour with a grand Mumbai showRapper Honey Singh launched his Millionaire Tour with a spectacular concert in Mumbai. The show featured dramatic entrances and a lineup of energetic performances.

Undercover High School X review: Fans give thumbs up to Seo Kang-joon's K-dramaUndercover High School, featuring Seo Kang-joon and Jin Ki-joo, has premiered on MBC TV. The series, praised for its engaging storyline, follows an undercover NIS agent as a high school student.

Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege. Ricco had once defended Osama bin Laden.

The series, featuring Park Hyung-sik, explores the complex dynamics of corporate intrigue and personal survival. Read the full review.

Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons: I'm poor, not criminal - focus on rape casesRakhi Sawant was summoned by the Maharashtra cyber cell to record her statement regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial remarks on Samay Raina's show, 'India's Got Latent'. She urged the police to focus on solving pending rape cases instead of treating her like a criminal.

Zero Day: Critics praise Robert De Niro, criticise show's 'incoherent politics'Critics have mixed reactions to Robert De Niro's latest Netflix series, Zero Day. While many have praised De Niro, a section of them are unhappy with the narrative of the show.

Grammy-nominated band OneRepublic unites with Karan Aujla for new song Tell MeGlobal pop-rock sensation OneRepublic is collaborating with Punjabi artist Karan Aujla for a new track titled Tell Me. It will release on February 27.

Mismatched actor Prajakta Koli to marry boyfriend on February 25: ReportActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry her boyfriend Vrishank Khanal on February 25. Their wedding festivities will begin on February 23.

Crime Beat review: Rahul Bhat, Saqib Saleem's crime drama gets lost in its own chaosReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025'Crime Beat', a political thriller, premiered on Zee5 on February 21. Based on the book titled 'The Price You Pay', the show falls short due to outdated tropes and exaggerated clichés.

general news.headline: Bihar cabinet expansion: 7 BJP leaders take oath as Nitish Kumar's ministersA glimpse of the Mithila culture was seen in the clothing of Sanjay Saraogi and Jibesh Kumar, among ministers who were inducted into the Bihar cabinet today.

Centre opposes plea on life ban for convicted politicians: 'Parliament's domain'The central government told the Supreme Court that a lifetime ban on convicted politicians is a legislative matter, arguing that existing disqualification rules ensure deterrence while maintaining proportionality and fairness.

Annamalai slams Vijay over language row, says 'practise what you preach, bro'Annamalai accused Vijay of double standards, questioning why his children and school follow a three-language policy while TVK promotes a two-language system. He also targeted Vijay over the #GetOut campaign, pointing out that Prashant Kishor abstained from signing the board.

If not Congress, the options that Shashi Tharoor hasWith his future in the Congress unclear, four-time MP Shashi Tharoor finds himself at a crossroads. He's welcomed by the Left, courted by the BJP, and experts speculate he could even launch his own political outfit. Will he carve a new path or join the BJP or remain adrift in the Congress? This is what Tharoor and political experts have to say.

How Trump's 'gold card' visa for the super rich will impact IndiansUS gold visa: Donald Trump announced a 'gold card' visa scheme for US citizenship for a hefty fee of USD 5 million. The program will compound the woes of skilled Indian professionals.

The timeless homecoming of the Olive Ridleys; well done OdishaThese turtles do not just return to the sands of Odisha; they return to an India that is learning, that is listening, that is making choices today that will echo across centuries.

Government mulls Universal Pension Scheme: Who will it benefit? Check details The ministry of labour and employment is working on the proposed plan, which is expected to bring existing pension schemes under one framework.

Arvind Kejriwal in Rajya Sabha buzz after AAP's bypoll move, party deniesThe AAP has fielded MP Sanjeev Arora in the Ludhiana West assembly bypoll, stirring up buzz about Arvind Kejriwal's Rajya Sabha entry. However, the party dismissed the speculations in a formal statement.

Superboys of Malegaon review: A fitting tribute to the love of cinema Released-Fri Feb 28, 2025Superboys of Malegaon movie review: This is a heartfelt film capturing the dreams and struggles of a group of boys in Malegaon who are passionate about making movies, reflecting the magic of cinema and the changing face of India.

Hair loss linked to contaminated atta. What is wheat selenium that's to blame?Over 300 people in Maharashtra's Buldhana district reported sudden hair loss and balding. A study by Padma Shri awardee physician Himmatrao Bawaskar found high levels of selenium in the wheat being distributed and consumed there as the reason for the surge in alopecia. Here's all about selenium, how it contaminates wheat, and the health risks from it.

Volkswagen only carmaker to wrongly classify car imports: Tax authoritiesIndia says Volkswagen used a clandestine scheme to import auto parts in separate shipments, to evade detection and cut taxes, instead of declaring items as "completely knocked down", or CKD, units that face higher taxes of 30% to 35%.

CBSE on row over Punjabi omission in Class 10 exams draft norms: List not finalPunjab's education minister claimed that CBSE's draft board exam policy omitted Punjabi from its subject list. The board has clarified that the list is not final and that no subjects will be removed.

Prajakta-Vrishank's love story: From BlackBerry messenger to dreamy Virginia proposalPrajakta Koli and Vrishank Khanal got married in a traditional ceremony in Karjat on Tuesday. The newly-weds now talked about their love story, and all the dreamy things that come with it.

Tamil Nadu won't lose a single seat: Amit Shah rejects Stalin's delimitation chargeHome Minister Amit Shah dismissed Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin's claim that the state would lose eight Lok Sabha seats due to delimitation, asserting that no southern state would see a reduction.

Jharkhand: Stones thrown, shops torched during clash over Shivratri decorationsThe incident, which happened in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh, took a violent turn as several vehicles and some shops were set on fire. Several people sustained injuries.

NEET PG 2024 cut-off reduced again, now at 5th percentile for allThe NEET PG 2024 qualifying percentile has been reduced once more. Now more candidates will be able to qualify till the 5th percentile across all categories and be eligible for counselling and medical admissions.

Fire officer reunites with college friend after 37 years at Maha Kumbh. Video goes viralSanjeev Kumar Singh and Rashmi Gupta, college classmates from the 1988 batch, reunited at the Maha Kumbh and documented their interaction in the video that has delighted the internet.

'Tower, how'd that happen?': Chilling ATC audio of near-miss at US airportA Southwest Airlines passenger plane nearly collided with a business jet during a landing attempt at Chicago's Midway airport. Air traffic control audio of the incident has raised troubling questions about the role of the private jet pilot.

Yograj Singh to Wasim, Shoaib: Don't just talk, I can fix Pakistan cricket in a yearFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh lashed out at the likes of Shoaib Akhtar and Wasim Akram, urging them to get out of the commentary boxes and help Pakistan players on the field. Yograj claimed he could fix Pakistan cricket team and improve their players in just a year.

South Korea internships with 100% fee waiver open to Indian students: Check detailsSouth Korea has announced the Seoul Tech Scholarship 2025, for Indian students from science and engineering backgrounds. It offers a 100% waiver on tuition fees. Applications are open till March 14.

Sunita had filed for divorce, but they are back together: Govinda's lawyerRumours have been rife about Govinda-Sunita's divorce. However, his lawyer has now clarified to India Today that Sunita had indeed filed for divorce six months earlier, but they are now "going strong".
What's driving the unusual February heatwave in Mumbai?February, being part of the winter season, usually sees much cooler temperatures compared to the peak summer months.

In visuals: What makes Telangana tunnel rescue challenging?India Today decodes the challenges hindering the rescue operations at Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC). Authorities blame accumulated sludge and continuous inflow of water into the tunnel for the slow rescue operation.

BJP leader's 'Oscar' remark for Air India. But it is not for what you thinkBJP's Jaiveer Shergill, in a hard-hitting post on X, shared his recent flight experience with the airline, listing a host of complaints - from broken seats to customer service.

Viral: Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Naga Chaitanya attend wedding in Abu DhabiIn a delightful sighting for fans, South Indian cinema stars Jr NTR, Ram Charan, and Naga Chaitanya were seen together in Abu Dhabi. The trio's picture has been making rounds on social media, captivating audiences.

Amit Trivedi says Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay was 'unfortunate'Amit Trivedi, in an interview with India Today Digital, discussed the controversy over Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay's India tour and whether it would impact on the image of Indian artists.

Samay Raina says 'I'm very worried' amid India's Got Latent rowComedian Samay Raina during his Canada show stated that he was very worried amid India's Got Latent row. His show was embroiled in controversy after YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remarks caused an uproar.

sports.headline: MS Dhoni lands in Chennai to join CSK pre-season camp: See picIPL 2025: MS Dhoni was spotted arriving at Chennai airport ahead of the Super Kings' pre-season camp. Playing only in Dubai helps India, but that's not why Pakistan lost: Aaqib JavedChampions Trophy: Speaking to the press on the eve of their last league game against Bangladesh in Rawalpindi, Pakistan head coach Aaqib Javed urged fans and pundits to be more understanding of the emotions in the dressing room after their tough loss to India. The former fast bowler also said India's familiarity with the conditions in Dubai is not why Pakistan lost the big-ticket clash on Sunday.

Who is Danish Malewar? 21-year-old batter lights up Ranji Trophy final with centuryRanji Trophy 2024-25: Right-handed batter Danish Malewar lit up the VCA Stadium in Nagpur after hitting a 168-ball hundred in the final between Vidarbha and Kerala.

Watch: Rohit Sharma takes a stroll in Dubai, triggering a massive fan frenzyIndia captain Rohit Sharma was seen taking a stroll on the streets of Dubai after their clinical win over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Virat Kohli proved why he is a big match player: Lalchand RajputLalchand Rajput hailed Virat Kohli's century against Pakistan as a reminder of his "big match" prowess. The knock not only secured India's semi-final spot but also silenced critics questioning his recent form in Test cricket.

Virat Kohli back in top 5, Shubman Gill extends lead over Babar AzamICC ODI Rankings: Following his hundred against Pakistan in Dubai, Virat Kohli has returned to the top five of men's ODI batting rankings. Shubman Gill has extended his lead over second-placed Babar Azam to 47 points.

Afghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi distanced cricket from politics, while the Taliban's restrictions on women's sport remain under scrutiny.

Security breach disrupts Champions Trophy in PakistanA security breach at Pakistan's Champions Trophy involved an intruder approaching cricketer Rachin Ravindra. The intruder, linked to an Islamist political group, has been banned by the Cricket Board.

Steve Smith, Rashid Khan to star in The Hundred, Ben Stokes pulls outSteve Smith and Rashid Khan secured The Hundred deals, while England's Ben Stokes opted out to manage his workload. The tournament also saw major signings, including Trent Boult, Marcus Stoinis, Meg Lanning, and Laura Wolvaardt.

DC dethrone RCB as table-toppers with dominating win vs Gujarat Giants WPL 2025: Delhi Capitals beat the Ash Gardner-led Gujarat Giants by six wickets and moved to the top of the table. Jess Jonassen picked up one wicket and scored a 32-ball 61 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Jos Buttler backs England to come good against Afghanistan's tough spin testEngland captain Jos Buttler is confident of his team to come good against the tough spin challenge against Afghanistan, who beat them during the last meeting between the two teams in the ODI World Cup 2023. Both teams will be eager for a win in the upcoming game as the loser of the match will get knocked out of the tournament.

ENG vs AFG: England captain Jos Buttler admits his job is on the lineEngland captain Jos Buttler has admitted that his job is on the line ahead of their clash against Afghanistan on Wednesday, February 25. Relief for Lakshya Sen as Supreme Court halts further probe in age fraud caseLakshya Sen was granted relief by the Supreme Court of India by staying the Karnataka High Court order that had permitted further investigation into an age fraud complaint against the badminton star and his brother, Chirag.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
